comments:
When a ftp connection isn't used for a longer time the ftp server closes the connection. When the connection is used after the server closed it an exception is logged:

org.globus.ftp.exception.ServerException: Server refused performing the request. Custom message:  (error code 1) [Nested exception message:  Custom message: Unexpected reply: 421 Idle Timeout: closing control connection.].  Nested exception is org.globus.ftp.exception.UnexpectedReplyCodeException:  Custom message: Unexpected reply: 421 Idle Timeout: closing control connection.

The plugin should try to re-establish the connection if it got lost.

(Btw, sorry for the empty report previously, I accidentally hit shift+enter)

Yes, that's true. It happens because it's not yet implemented stuff.
And I go even further - I will implement "keep alive" functionality. 

But need some comments on that - is it "a must" or just "fancy feature"?

In my opinion automatic reconnecting after loosing a connection is a must have (At the moment it is not possible to recover a connection after it got lost). A connection keep alive feature is nice to have, but I think at the moment not necessary.

Ok, it's done.

UI developers should be aware to use exceptions thrown by GridFTP plugin to create user friendly information.
I've done it for gExplorer and will do it for GridProjectView when Mathias will be more available to help me.

BTW - Keep alive functionality is done too (default is 10 minutes peroid).

traces.message: Custom message: Unexpected reply: 421 Idle Timeout: closing control connection.
